page.title: 13A Kelso Policeman's Work
page.content: The first thing a local policeman does when coming on duty is to sign on, in an official book. Their{shifts}are, {6:00am - 2:00pm}early shift,{2:00pm - {10:00pm}back shift, and{10:00pm - {6:00am}night shift.{50%}of the police walk the beat and{50%}use vehicles. In Kelso the crime rate is relatively low, not many burglaries and violent crime; but some{vandalism.}They wear the normal black and white uniform and carry a baton, notebook and whistle. Kelso has no major traffic problems although the Square and surrounding streets can be very busy at times. The local police cover a large area: Kelso Burgh, the outlying villages and farms within a radius of roughly 8 miles. In the past month the policeman we interviewed had made 3 arrests, all usually during night shift.
